meanings.definition: The act of making someone overly sensitive or reactive to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: Her constant criticism led to his hypersensitizations to any feedback.
meanings.sent2: The child's hypersensitizations to loud noises made fireworks difficult to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: His hypersensitizations to jokes about his height made him the target of many pranks.
meanings.sent4: The hypersensitizations of the security guard to any movement made sneaking past him nearly impossible.
meanings.sent5: The hypersensitizations of the patient to certain foods required careful monitoring of their diet.

meanings.definition: The state of being excessively sensitive or reactive to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, his hypersensitizations to light made him wear sunglasses indoors.
meanings.sent2: The hypersensitizations of the cat to touch made grooming a challenging task.
meanings.sent3: The hypersensitizations of the dog to the doorbell resulted in endless barking.
meanings.sent4: Her hypersensitizations to criticism were like open wounds, easily hurt.
meanings.sent5: The hypersensitizations of the plant to sunlight meant it had to be kept in the shade.
